We’re shocked and saddened by the tragic news out of New Zealand. Our hearts go out to the families of those missing. New Zealand is our neighbor and friend in the Pacific, and it a beautiful place full of wonderful people. Our prayers are with them today.

(continued) I know that as this sad news reaches everyone in American Samoa that our people will be praying, and we send New Zealand our love.

(continued) I’ve met with many of our wonderful community of Samoan friends living there. New Zealand is such a welcoming, beautiful place. Just days ago, I was speaking with their Ambassador to the U.S. about all our countries share...

The reports from New Zealand are heartbreaking. We are mourning with them today. In American Samoa, we think of the other Pacific islands as our neighbors, we come together with them for major sporting events, and many of us have had reason to travel to New Zealand...
Talofa! Enjoyed welcoming friends from American Samoa visiting the @usedgov in DC. We appreciate our educators! (Too many to name here, but I will over at my Instagram) pic.twitter.com/9gGvKrypoj

Talofa! President George H.W. Bush once commended one of our own in American Samoa, Faiva Ae, daughter of High Chief Pulu. He awarded her the special Point of Light Award, based on his timeless call for us to be a ‘thousand points of light’ to those around us.

As all the bios of President George H.W. Bush are being published, we're especially reminded of his heroic service as a young navy pilot in World War II. Here, he's pictured with another Veteran who served in the Pacific, American Samoa's Gov. Tali P.T. Coleman pic.twitter.com/sPXwE9JQLg

What a wonderful life! George H. W. Bush will be missed, and we're better for his service. This 1980s photo with the President in an aloha shirt was taken at a reception out on the ocean at Pearl Harbor during the Pacific Island Leaders’ Summit at East-West Center, Hawai'i. pic.twitter.com/r7QgsLw0Jl
